events.originalText: Supporters of Congolese religious leader Paul-Joseph Mukungubila carried out a series of attacks on television studios, the airport and a military base in Kinshasa.
events.subtitle: Paul-Joseph Mukungubila
events.headline: Supporters of Congolese religious leader Paul-Joseph Mukungubila carry out attacks in Kinshasa

events.originalText: Due to a rupture of the Lanzhou–Zhengzhou–Changsha pipeline in Shaanxi, China, caused approximately 150,000 l (40,000 US gal) of diesel oil flowed down the Wei River before finally reaching the Yellow River six days later.
events.subtitle: Lanzhou–Zhengzhou–Changsha pipeline
events.headline: 150,000 liters of diesel oil flow into Yellow River after pipeline rupture in Shaanxi, China

events.originalText: Pro-government counter-demonstrators held rallies in several Iranian cities in response to recent anti-government protests on the holy day of Ashura.
events.subtitle: December 30, 2009, Iranian pro-government rallies
events.headline: Pro-government rallies held in Iranian cities in response to anti-government protests on Ashura

events.originalText: The Indonesian ferry MV Senopati Nusantara sank in the Java Sea during a storm, killing at least 400 people.
events.subtitle: MV Senopati Nusantara
events.headline: Indonesian ferry MV Senopati Nusantara sinks in Java Sea, killing at least 400

events.originalText: Basque nationalist group ETA detonated a van bomb at Madrid–Barajas Airport in Spain, ending a nine-month ceasefire.
events.subtitle: Basque nationalism
events.headline: ETA detonates van bomb at Madrid–Barajas Airport in Spain, ending ceasefire

events.originalText: Saddam Hussein, the former President of Iraq, was executed after being found guilty of crimes against humanity by the Iraqi Special Tribunal.
events.subtitle: Saddam Hussein
events.headline: Former Iraqi President Saddam Hussein executed for crimes against humanity

events.originalText: Tropical Storm Zeta was declared a tropical depression, making it the record-breaking 28th tropical cyclone of the 2005 Atlantic hurricane season, the most active in recorded history until 2020.
events.subtitle: Tropical Storm Zeta (2005)
events.headline: Tropical Storm Zeta becomes record-breaking 28th cyclone of 2005 Atlantic hurricane season

events.originalText: A series of bombings occurred around Metro Manila in the Philippines, killing 22 people and injuring around 100 others.
events.subtitle: Rizal Day bombings
events.headline: Bombings in Metro Manila, Philippines, kill 22 and injure around 100

events.originalText: Philippine president Ferdinand Marcos began his second term after being re-elected by a landslide, but economic unrest led him to declare martial law within a year.
events.subtitle: Ferdinand Marcos
events.headline: Philippine president Ferdinand Marcos begins second term amid economic unrest

events.originalText: The Guatemalan Air Force fired on Mexican fishing boats that had strayed into Guatemalan territory, triggering an eight-month conflict.
events.subtitle: Guatemalan Air Force
events.headline: Guatemalan Air Force fires on Mexican fishing boats, triggering eight-month conflict

events.originalText: The Finnish National Bureau of Investigation was established to consolidate criminal investigation and intelligence into a single agency.
events.subtitle: National Bureau of Investigation (Finland)
events.headline: Finnish National Bureau of Investigation established to consolidate criminal investigation

events.originalText: The Arroyo Seco Parkway (pictured), one of the first freeways built in the U.S., connecting downtown Los Angeles with Pasadena, California, was officially dedicated.
events.subtitle: Arroyo Seco Parkway
events.headline: Arroyo Seco Parkway officially dedicated, connecting Los Angeles with Pasadena

events.originalText: Second Italo-Abyssinian War: The Italian Air Force destroyed a Swedish Red Cross field hospital in Dolo, Ethiopia, in retaliation for the earlier execution of an Italian prisoner of war.
events.subtitle: Second Italo-Ethiopian War
events.headline: Italian Air Force destroys Swedish Red Cross field hospital in Ethiopia

events.originalText: The All-India Muslim League, a political party in British India that developed into the driving force behind the creation of Pakistan as a Muslim state on the Indian subcontinent, was founded in Dhaka.
events.subtitle: All-India Muslim League
events.headline: All-India Muslim League founded in Dhaka, driving force behind creation of Pakistan

events.originalText: In one of the deadliest single-building fires in United States history, the Iroquois Theatre fire in Chicago killed more than 600 people.
events.subtitle: Iroquois Theatre fire
events.headline: Iroquois Theatre fire in Chicago kills over 600 people in deadliest single-building fire

events.originalText: The Discovery Expedition under Robert Falcon Scott attained a new Farthest South point in Antarctica.
events.subtitle: Discovery Expedition
events.headline: Discovery Expedition attains new Farthest South point in Antarctica

events.originalText: War of 1812: British forces captured Buffalo, New York, and burned down nearly all its buildings.
events.subtitle: War of 1812
events.headline: British forces capture Buffalo, New York, and burn down buildings in War of 1812

events.originalText: Queen Anne's War: James Moore, the British colonial governor of Carolina, abandoned a siege against St. Augustine in Spanish Florida and retreated to Charles Town in disgrace.
events.subtitle: Queen Anne's War
events.headline: British colonial governor of Carolina abandons siege against St. Augustine in Queen Anne's War

events.originalText: Wars of the Roses: At the Battle of Wakefield, Lancastrian forces destroyed the Yorkist army and killed Richard of York (pictured) at Sandal Magna in West Yorkshire, England.
events.subtitle: Wars of the Roses
events.headline: Lancastrian forces defeat Yorkists at Battle of Wakefield, killing Richard of York in Wars of the Roses

events.originalText: In Ireland, the combined forces of Munster and Meath crushed a rebellion by Leinster and Dublin.
events.subtitle: AD 999
events.headline: Forces of Munster and Meath crush rebellion by Leinster and Dublin in Ireland
